title: mRemoteNG saves User-Settings not in RoamingProfiles
author: tcn-pdr
body_snippet:
<!--
Only file GitHub issues for bugs and feature requests.  All other topics will be closed.

Before opening an issue, please search for a duplicate or closed issue.
Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue.
-->

<!-- Bug -->
User-Settings are saved in Path C:\ Users\ %Username%\ AppData\ Local\ mRemoteNG\ *Crypted Path*\ 1.75.7008.17907\ user.config and not in RoamingProfiles.
We use mRemoteNG on a Citrix XenApp Server and would like to set the User-Settings ...

iterations.description: The issue is already closed and comments confirm that settings storage was updated to use the Roaming AppData directory.

comments.author: LIyoai
comments.snippet:
Do you use the portable version?
https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/414 (scheduled for 1.76)
https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/487

comments.author: tcn-pdr
comments.snippet:
No, we use the installed Version

Version is 1.75.7008.17907

comments.author: penguinairlines
comments.snippet:
Is this issue not fixed?  I had bookmarked it after having an issue with themes not being saved in the folder, but I just downloaded 1.76.11.40592 (portable) and was able to apply the theme, copy folder to another machine, and launch mRemoteNG which had kept the theme.

P.S. I noticed that the Stable and Beta downloads on GitHub are reporting v1.75.7012 https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG and not sure the appropriate place to make this comment since it's not an issue outright.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
@penguinairlines As of v1.76 the portable version saves user preferences in the same folder as mRemoteNG.exe. The installed version still saves to AppData\Local

(Thanks for pointing out the badges, I've updated them now)

comments.author: penguinairlines
comments.snippet: @sparerd Awesome! Looks like we can close this issue then!

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: The installed (msi) version saves to AppData\Local and should still be changed

comments.author: penguinairlines
comments.snippet:
Ah good point! Carry on then!

Keep up the awesome work guys, your tool is fantastic!

comments.author: kmscode
comments.snippet:
Now that #414 is fixed in the portable version, we could fix this easily either with a quick change in PortableSettingsProvider - basically mimic what we do in SettingsFileInfo.cs:

```
public static string SettingsPath => Runtime.IsPortableEdition ? ExePath : Environment.GetFolderPath(Environment.SpecialFolder.ApplicationData) + "\\" + Application.ProductName;
```

comments.author: farosch
comments.snippet: Closed, because both versions (MSI and Portable) now use the `%APPDATA%` directory

notes:
AI triage (gemini): The issue is already closed and comments confirm that settings storage was updated to use the Roaming AppData directory.
